item.title: Anonymous: Re: First post from DebConf 10
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Let me know about discussions about sagemath and happy DebConf!

item.title: Anonymous: Re: First post from DebConf 10
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
This was my first Debconf as well and I was glad to meet you at the event. Thank you for making me feel welcome in Debian even though I'm new here.

P.S. the updates to the package I am working on http://packages.debian.org/sid/xtrkcad were implemented, sponsored, and uploaded the day before the freeze.

item.title: Anonymous: Re: A version of xpdf with the poppler backend available
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: I just learned about existence of epdfview which is using poppler.. so why should average user choose xpdf-poppler over epdfview?

item.title: Anonymous: Re: A version of xpdf with the poppler backend available
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
There are some reasons:

it is lighter (and depends on fewer packages, and is better for those using it remotely etc)
it has the ability to zoom more, which both evince and epdfview don't; even if you patch them to use higher zoom levels, as they render the whole page at once, they will bring your computer to a halt

item.title: Anonymous: Re: A version of xpdf with the poppler backend available
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Oh, thanks for the report. Indeed, it was missing a comma there. It is fixed on the repository.

Regarding the floating point exception, could you please give me some details more? I can't reproduce it and I would love to fix this as soon as possible. Which architecture are you using? Which version of poppler? Right now, I am developing with an amd64 and with Debian's poppler 0.12.4-1.

If you could provide me with further details on http://github.com/rbrito/xpdf-poppler/issues I would be grateful to help.

A very kind Gentoo user also tested a version and confirmed that it is working on his system.

Thanks.

item.title: Anonymous: Re: A version of xpdf with the poppler backend available
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: a great project.. does it work currently? I tried to build it on my laptop, there's a comma missing in xpdf.cc:65 and starting ends with a "Floating point exception".

item.title: Anonymous: Re: Preliminary support for webm in youtube-dl
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Hi, Sebastian.

Yes, yes, I know that this "something" is the gstreamer infrastructure. Just excuse my lack of abilities with English. I was so excited to have understood how the videos could be found with youtube-dl and push the release as soon as possible that I didn't think very much about the phrasing.

Anyway, that's great and I am using gstreamer with a lot of programs (and I am enjoying the gst123 command line program that Ahmed El-Mahmoudy uploaded and just got accepted from the NEW queue).

Thanks for your job, BTW.

item.title: Anonymous: Re: Preliminary support for webm in youtube-dl
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: How about pushing those libvorbis patches upstream to xiph.org?!!?

item.title: Anonymous: Re: Preliminary support for webm in youtube-dl
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Way to go Sebastian, your little something will make youtube-dl mostly obsolete for me, since it now works fine in Epiphany!

item.title: Anonymous: Re: Preliminary support for webm in youtube-dl
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
This "something" makes it possible to play or create WebM files in software that uses GStreamer. For example with epiphany-browser you'll be able to watch the WebM YouTube videos, transmageddon can create WebM files out of everything else, etc

(And of course GNOME's official media player totem can play the WebM files if gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad is installed)
